description.raw:
In my overnight testing, I've noticed several seg-faults when de-referencing a null `rendering::Light` pointer in the `CameraSensor.Light` test. There are two issues here:

* we are using `EXPECT_TRUE` instead of `ASSERT_TRUE` when checking pointers.
* there is a typo and the `sensor` pointer is checked instead of `sun`.

This just helps the test fail more cleanly, but I've noticed that it's pretty flaky. I've never seen it pass 10 times in a row. It typically fails with the `sun` pointer being null. I've tried adding a wait loop, but it doesn't seem to help. I'm not sure how to improve it. Do you have any ideas @iche033?
description.html:
In my overnight testing, I've noticed several seg-faults when de-referencing a null rendering::Light pointer in the CameraSensor.Light test. There are two issues here:

  • we are using EXPECT_TRUE instead of ASSERT_TRUE when checking pointers.
  • there is a typo and the sensor pointer is checked instead of sun.

This just helps the test fail more cleanly, but I've noticed that it's pretty flaky. I've never seen it pass 10 times in a row. It typically fails with the sun pointer being null. I've tried adding a wait loop, but it doesn't seem to help. I'm not sure how to improve it. Do you have any ideas @iche033?

title.raw: CameraSensor.Light test: change some EXPECT to ASSERT
